artifacts.summary: SemanticTaskFrame and SemanticTaskModel with Int time domain - working infrastructure
Truth correspondence attempts with documented architectural gap
Detailed documentation of why the approach fails

partial_progress.details: Research approach invalid - truth correspondence requires assignment = recursive evaluation for ALL world states, which only holds for MCS-derived states. The forward truth lemma gap documented in Boneyard/TruthLemmaGap.lean applies here too.
partial_progress.blocker: The bridge from valid(phi) to semantic_truth_at_v2 is architecturally impossible. semantic_truth_at_v2 checks assignment truth, while valid requires recursive semantic truth. These only coincide for MCS-derived world states, not arbitrary locally-consistent ones.

completion_data.completion_summary: Attempted to prove weak_completeness sorry-free via semantic model embedding. Implementation revealed the approach faces the same architectural gap as the original forward truth lemma - assignment-based truth differs from recursive truth for non-MCS-derived world states. Created SemanticTaskFrame infrastructure and documented the gap.
